consumptionModel.CPUModel package

Submodules

consumptionModel.CPUModel.CPUModel module

class consumptionModel.CPUModel.CPUModel.CPUModel(node: node.Node.Node)

Bases: object

A class that represents the module of the processor consumption model of the nodes.

…

node

The node assigned to this model.

Type

Node

get_node(): Node

Return the node.

set_node():

Assign this consumption model to a node.

check_cpu():

Check if the node has reached the maximum CPU consumption level.

update_cpu():

Update the CPU consumption percentage of the node.

Methods

check_cpu()

Check if the node has reached the maximum CPU consumption level.

get_node()

Return the instance of the node.

set_node(node)

Assign this consumption model to a node.

update_cpu(cpu_usage)

Update the CPU consumption percentage of the node.
__init__(node: node.Node.Node)

Constructs all the necessary attributes for the CPUModel object.

Parameters

node (Node) – The node assigned to this model.

Examples

>>> cpuModel = CPUModel(node=node1)
check_cpu() → bool

Check if the node has reached the maximum CPU consumption level.

Returns

status (bool)

Return type

If the maximum level of consumption is reached or not.

Examples

>>> cpuModel.check_cpu()

Return the instance of the node.

Returns

nodes (Node)

Return type

The node’s instance.

Examples

>>> cpuModel.get_node()
set_node(node: node.Node.Node)

Assign this consumption model to a node.

Parameters

node (Node) – the node’s instance.

Examples

>>> cpuModel.set_node(node1)
update_cpu(cpu_usage)

Update the CPU consumption percentage of the node.

Parameters

cpu_usage (float) – the new level of processor consumption.

Examples

>>> cpuModel.update_cpu(65)
